segment.source: This article shows you how video device controls to enable enhanced video capture scenarios including: HDR video and exposure priority.
segment.target: This article shows you how video device controls to enable enhanced video capture scenarios including: HDR video and exposure priority.

segment.source: The video device controls discussed in this article are all added to your app using the same pattern.
segment.target: The video device controls discussed in this article are all added to your app using the same pattern.

segment.source: First, you check to see if the control is supported on the current device on which your app is running.
segment.target: First, you check to see if the control is supported on the current device on which your app is running.

segment.source: If the control is supported, then you set the desired mode for the control.
segment.target: If the control is supported, then you set the desired mode for the control.

segment.source: Typically, if a particular control is unsupported on the current device, you should disable or hide the UI element that allows the user to enable the feature.
segment.target: Typically, if a particular control is unsupported on the current device, you should disable or hide the UI element that allows the user to enable the feature.

segment.source: All of the device control APIs discussed in this article are members of the Windows.Media.Devices namespace.
segment.target: All of the device control APIs discussed in this article are members of the Windows.Media.Devices namespace.

segment.source: HDR video
segment.target: HDR video

segment.source: The High Dynamic Range (HDR) video feature applies HDR processing to the video stream of the capture device.
segment.target: The High Dynamic Range (HDR) video feature applies HDR processing to the video stream of the capture device.

segment.source: Determine if HDR video is supported by checking the HdrVideoControl.Supported property.
segment.target: Determine if HDR video is supported by checking the HdrVideoControl.Supported property.

segment.source: The HDR video control supports three modes: on, off, and automatic, which means that the device dynamically determines if HDR video processing would improve the media capture and, if so, enables HDR video.
segment.target: The HDR video control supports three modes: on, off, and automatic, which means that the device dynamically determines if HDR video processing would improve the media capture and, if so, enables HDR video.

segment.source: To determine if a particular mode is supported on the current device, check to see if the HdrVideoControl.SupportedModes collection contains the desired mode.
segment.target: To determine if a particular mode is supported on the current device, check to see if the HdrVideoControl.SupportedModes collection contains the desired mode.

segment.source: Enable or disable HDR video processing by setting the HdrVideoControl.Mode to the desired mode.
segment.target: Enable or disable HDR video processing by setting the HdrVideoControl.Mode to the desired mode.

segment.source: Exposure priority
segment.target: Exposure priority

segment.source: The ExposurePriorityVideoControl, when enabled, evaluates the video frames from the capture device to determine if the video is capturing a low-light scene.
segment.target: The ExposurePriorityVideoControl, when enabled, evaluates the video frames from the capture device to determine if the video is capturing a low-light scene.

segment.source: If so, the control lowers the frame rate of the captured video in order to increase the exposure time for each frame and improve the visual quality of the captured video.
segment.target: If so, the control lowers the frame rate of the captured video in order to increase the exposure time for each frame and improve the visual quality of the captured video.

segment.source: Determine if the exposure priority control is supported on the current device by checking the ExposurePriorityVideoControl.Supported property.
segment.target: Determine if the exposure priority control is supported on the current device by checking the ExposurePriorityVideoControl.Supported property.

segment.source: Enable or disable the exposure priority control by setting the ExposurePriorityVideoControl.Enabled to the desired mode.
segment.target: Enable or disable the exposure priority control by setting the ExposurePriorityVideoControl.Enabled to the desired mode.
